events.originalText: Coordinated terrorist attacks in Paris perpetrated by the Islamic State killed 130 people and injured 413 others.
events.subtitle: November 2015 Paris attacks
events.headline: Islamic State Terrorist Attacks in Paris Kill 130, Injure 413

events.originalText: The High Court of Australia ruled in Dietrich v The Queen that, although there is no absolute right to have publicly funded counsel, a judge should grant any request for an adjournment or stay in most circumstances in which an accused is unrepresented.
events.subtitle: High Court of Australia
events.headline: High Court of Australia Rules in Dietrich v The Queen on Legal Representation

events.originalText: Nevado del Ruiz (pictured) erupted, causing a volcanic mudslide that buried the town of Armero, Colombia, killing approximately 23,000 people.
events.subtitle: Nevado del Ruiz
events.headline: Nevado del Ruiz Eruption Buries Armero, Colombia, Killing 23,000

events.originalText: South Korean boxer Kim Duk-koo suffered fatal brain injuries during a match with American Ray Mancini in Las Vegas, leading to significant rule changes in the sport.
events.subtitle: Kim Duk-koo
events.headline: South Korean Boxer Kim Duk-koo Dies from Injuries in Las Vegas Match

events.originalText: In Amityville, New York, Ronald DeFeo Jr. killed the other six members of his family, later inspiring the book The Amityville Horror and the subsequent media franchise.
events.subtitle: Amityville, New York
events.headline: Ronald DeFeo Jr. Kills Family in Amityville, New York, Inspiring Horror Franchise

events.originalText: The Israeli military conducted a large cross-border assault on the Jordanian-controlled West Bank village of Samu in response to a Fatah land mine incident.
events.subtitle: Samu incident
events.headline: Israeli Military Conducts Cross-Border Assault on Samu Village in West Bank

events.originalText: A man wielding a dagger was subdued as he was about to attack Sanzō Nosaka, the chairman of the Japanese Communist Party.
events.subtitle: Sanzō Nosaka
events.headline: Japanese Communist Party Chairman Sanzō Nosaka Targeted in Dagger Attack

events.originalText: Walt Disney's Fantasia, the first commercial film shown with stereophonic sound, premiered at the Broadway Theatre in New York City.
events.subtitle: Walt Disney
events.headline: Walt Disney's Fantasia Premieres with Stereophonic Sound in New York City

events.originalText: The Holland Tunnel (eastbound trip shown) opened, connecting Manhattan with Jersey City under the Hudson River.
events.subtitle: Holland Tunnel
events.headline: Holland Tunnel Opens, Connecting Manhattan with Jersey City

events.originalText: Zaian War: Zaian Berber tribesmen routed French forces in Morocco at the Battle of El Herri.
events.subtitle: Zaian War
events.headline: Zaian Berber Tribesmen Defeat French Forces at Battle of El Herri in Morocco

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: Patriot forces captured Montreal without significant opposition as part of the Invasion of Quebec.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Patriot Forces Capture Montreal in American Revolutionary War

events.originalText: First English Civil War: Royalist forces engaged the much larger Parliamentarian army at the Battle of Turnham Green near Turnham Green, Middlesex.
events.subtitle: First English Civil War
events.headline: Royalist Forces Battle Parliamentarians at Turnham Green in First English Civil War

events.originalText: King Æthelred II ordered the massacre of all Danes in England.
events.subtitle: Æthelred the Unready
events.headline: King Æthelred II Orders Massacre of Danes in England
